entry.title: Banking partner delay
entry.summary: Mar 10, 23:13 UTC Update - All payments with a check date of March 10th have been successfully submitted. Some have been completed, and others will complete between Saturday, March 11th and Monday, March 13th. This morning, Rippling was assured by SVB that all payments would be processed today. However, when SVB fell into receivership with the FDIC, we immediately began working with JPMorgan Chase to find an alternative means to send funds to employees. As a result of the actions we took, all employees will receive their payments between today and Monday morning, depending on which bank they use. Rippling has extended our own capital to fund these payments while client funds are locked up with SVB. When will employees with a March 10, 2023 check date be paid? - Employees with Chase bank a…

entry.title: Incident: Some customers are seeing errors when attempting to connect Google Drive
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On March 9, 2023 from 8:28 PM to March 10, 2023 8:40 AM PST, some users that were signed into multiple workspaces experienced a redirect issue when signing into the Google Drive app from Slack.
After the sign-in button was clicked, the user was redirected to a different Slack workspace they were signed into, causing a 400 Bad Request response.
We made a code change to ensure the user was redirected to the proper workspace, fixing the authentication error and resolving the issue.

entry.title: United Kingdom Account Security Carrier Partner Maintenance
entry.summary: Mar 10, 11:00 PST In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary. Mar 2, 04:46 PST Scheduled - Our Carrier Partner Three UK is conducting a planned maintenance from 10 March 2023 at 11:00 PST until 13 March 2023 at 16:59 PST. During the maintenance window, there could be intermittent API request failures for UK. Impacted Products: Lookup SIM Swap and Identity Match

Mar 10, 02:24 PST Monitoring - We are observing recovery in SMS delivery delays when sending messages to Zain network. We will continue monitoring the service to ensure a full recovery. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available. Mar 10, 00:20 PST Update - We are experiencing Outbound SMS delivery delays when sending messages to Zain network in Jordan. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hour or as soon as more information becomes available. Mar 9, 23:23 PST Investigating - We are experiencing Outbound SMS delivery delays when sending messages to Zain network in Jordan. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

entry.title: Incident: Service degradation in Slack
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On March 9, 2023 from 9:07 AM to 10:06 AM PST, some users experienced trouble with various features in Slack, such as adding bookmarks to channels, using workflows, connecting to Slack, or sending Slack Connect invites.
We discovered the service degradation was prompted by a load test that ran at a higher rate than intended, causing database outages to occur. To remediate the issue, we scaled back the load test to the normal rate which resolved the problem for all impacted users.

Mar 9, 19:22 UTC Monitoring - We've identified a root cause for the issue and have resolved page loading issues. We are continuing to monitor for any further issues. Mar 9, 18:40 UTC Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

entry.title: RESOLVED: Our team is continuing to investigate this issue. We will provide an update by Mar 9, 2023, 12:00 AM UTC with more information about this problem. Thank you for your patience.
entry.summary:
Incident began at 2023-03-07 15:00 and ended at 2023-03-09 09:03 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

Mini Incident Report

We apologize for the inconvenience this service disruption/outage may have caused. We would like to provide some information about this incident below. Please note, this information is based on our best knowledge at the time of posting and is subject to change as our investigation continues. If you have experienced impact outside of what is listed below, please reach out to Google Cloud Support using https://cloud.google.com/support or to Google Workspace Support using help article https://support.google.com/a/answer/1047213.

(All Times US/Pacific)

Incident Start: 7 March, 2023 07:00

Incident End: 9 March, 2023 01:09

Duration: 1 day, 18 hours, 9 minutes

Affected Services and Features:

Admin Console

Regions/Zones: Global

Description:

The Google Workspace Admin Console displayed 0 customer-level storage usage for 1 day, 18 hours, and 9 minutes. This issue only affected Workspace customer admins viewing the Storage page in the Admin Console. From preliminary analysis, the root cause of the issue was a failure in a background process that populates storage usage data.

During this time, admins would have been able to view the correct storage usage in Drive.

Customer Impact:

Workspace customer admins would have observed 0 customer-level storage data in the Admin Console.

Affected products: Admin Console

entry.title: Important information regarding your website domain!
entry.summary:
Communications
We will be doing some improvements on our website infrastructure which may temporarily affect your websites. The maintenance will take place on tuesday March 14, 2023 at 06:00am CET and will have a duration of 3 hours max. What will be the impact? · Websites may not be unreachable for up to 10 minutes at maintenance time. · SSL may be unavailable from the beginning of the maintenance for up to 3 hours (website will still be reachable without https) Do I need to do anything? This maintenance will impact the DNS zone we are using to link your website to our infrastructure, therefore some changes will be required in the 2 weeks following this update if you are using your own domain name with A records. We will send a second communication with the information and update our manual to help you with this transition. Of course our support team will be there to assist you. Thank you for your comprehension,

author.name: Yannick, Customer Care Team Leader - Pro Team

entry.title: Incident: Slowness searching in Slack
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On March 7, 2023 from 9:15 AM to 6:31 PM PST, some users may have experienced slow search response times or failed searches.
We made a routine adjustment to our infrastructure that inadvertently increased load and decreased response rates for our search servers. New messages sent during this period were not indexed immediately and would not have been searchable.
We restarted the affected server nodes, returning search performance to normal and allowing the system to catch up on the backlogged indexing tasks. Once the system handled the backlog and we confirmed that indexing was complete, full search functionality was restored to all customers.
Thank you for your patience while we worked through this. We apologize for any disruption to your work.

entry.title: Increased latency and intermittent API failures
entry.summary: Mar 8, 23:58 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Mar 8, 21:41 UTC Monitoring - Starting at 12:20 pacific time, we started seeing increased latency and intermittent API failures across all Rippling products. From 1 pm PT, latencies and API failures have recovered, and we are now continuing to monitor for any further issues.

entry.title: Incident: Some users are not receiving emails from Slack
entry.summary:
Issue Summary:
On Sunday March 5, 2023 from 4:00pm PST to March 6, 2023 1:51pm PST, some users weren't receiving sign-in codes, or the codes were delivered to their spam folder.
Our team determined this wasn't an issue caused by Slack, but a third-party email provider.
To ensure emails from Slack are successfully routed to the appropriate inbox, impacted users should add the domains @slack.com and @slack-mail.com, to their trusted senders list.

entry.title: Incident: Users are experiencing issues connecting to Slack
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On March 3rd, 2023 from 9:03 AM PST to 9:13 AM PST, some users had trouble logging into Slack, sending messages and completing API requests.
The cause of this issue was in relation to a planned exercise where we removed traffic from an isolated location to simulate failure of a single data center. In our investigation, we discovered that one database experienced an issue causing the exercise to fail. We were able to quickly identify the failure and apply a manual fix which resolved the issue. We determined less than 1% of our customers were affected.

entry.title: Incident: Some users may experience issues accessing api.slack.com
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On March 2nd, 2023 from 4:00 AM PST to 7:00 AM PST, some users were receiving errors related to an invalid date on their SSL certificate when calling Slack's APIs.
We discovered that an update we released on our SSL certificate was causing the issues. We've rolled back the update and the issue was resolved.

entry.title: Incident: Audio files not loading on iOS
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
From February 22nd, 2023 at 2:00 PM until February 24th, 2023 2:16 PM PST, some users experienced issues loading audio files on iOS.
We discovered that the server was returning an unexpected code in response to requests for audio files, causing the app to only partially load the content. We made a change to ensure the server returned the correct response code, resolving the issue for all affected customers.
If you continue to run into any trouble, please feel free to reach out to us at feedback@slack.com.

entry.title: Incident: Some customers may be experiencing issues with several apps
entry.summary:
Issue Summary:
From February 23, 2023 at 4:00 p.m. PST until February 24, 2023 at 12:13 a.m. PST, some customers were not able to use several apps within the workspace. The issue was caused by a certificate, which didn't push online successfully after renewal. The certificate has now been pushed and the issue is resolved.
*The times mentioned above have been updated since our initial posting to accurately reflect the duration of this issue.

entry.title: Incident: Some customers in the Phillipines may not be able to connect to Slack
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
From February 23, 2023 at 5:24 p.m. PST until February 23, 2023 at 8:23 p.m. PST, some customers in the Phillipines were not able to access Slack. We looked into it and found that the issue was an external factor that we have now addressed it on our end and the impacted users have confirmed that they can now access Slack.

entry.title: User experience may be degraded, API timing out. Scenario executions not affected.
entry.summary: Feb 23, 20:35 CET Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Feb 23, 18:52 CET Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results. Feb 23, 18:02 CET Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue. Feb 23, 17:18 CET Investigating - Website performance may be degraded and API requests are timing out. Users may not be able to use the web interface to manage their organizations and scenarios. The team is currently investigating the root cause of the issue.

entry.title: Incident: Errors when running workflows
entry.summary:
Issue Summary:
On February 22nd, 2023 from 08:44 AM PST to 09:22 AM PST, some users experienced issues with using workflows.
We discovered an issue that prevented workflow API calls from successfully writing changes to our database. After restarting this process, workflow functionality was restored for all impacted users.
We continued monitoring our metrics and announced the resolution when we were confident the issue was resolved.
If you continue to run into any issues please feel free to reach out to our support team.

entry.title: Incident: Some customers are experiencing server errors with the GitHub Enterprise Server app
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
From Monday February 20th 2023 at 15:00 PST until Tuesday February 21st 2023 22:00 PST,
A PR that changed the type of an argument used by the Github plugin was pushed to production. This change caused a type mismatch and subsequently HTTP 500 errors. The issue was resolved once the PR was reverted.
We're very sorry for any inconvenience caused.

entry.title: Incident: Issues with mobile notifications for Enterprise Grid customers
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
From Tuesday, February 14th, 2023 at 09:52 AM PST until Tuesday, February 21st, 2023 at 08:56 AM PST, some enterprise customers experienced issues with the delivery of mobile notifications on Android devices.
Our team identified that the cause of the issue was linked to a recent change with notification clearing. We rolled back this change which fixed the issue.
We're very sorry for any inconvenience caused.

entry.title: Incident: Some customers are having issues loading the admin page
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
From February 14th, 2023 at 10:49AM PST until February 20th, 2023 at 1:16 AM PST some customers were unable to load their workspace's admin page. We traced this issue to a recent code change, which resulted in the workspace token being invalidated when visiting the admin page from a browser. Reverting this code change fixed the issue for all affected customers.

entry.title: Incident: Files upload API not uploading files to thread
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On Tuesday February 14th, 2023 from 1:19 AM PST to 3:50 AM PST some customers reported an issue where the API method files.upload created a new message instead of uploading files in a thread.
Our team identified that the cause of the issue was linked to a recent update. This change was rolled back which fixed the issue.
Note: This summary has been edited since its initial posting to better align with Slack's communication guidelines.

entry.title: Incident: Threads are currently not loading for some users
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On Monday February 13th, 2023 at 07:00PM to Tuesday February 14th, 2023 at 01:02 AM PST, customers were unable to view threads in public channels they had not joined. This was caused by a recent code change - we've deployed a correction to this and the issue is now resolved.
Should customers continue to experience this behaviour, a hard refresh of the Slack client will fix this.

entry.title: Performance Issues
entry.summary: Feb 13, 08:36 PST Resolved - Engineering has implemented mitigations, which should have resolved performance issues. We’ll continue to monitor performance and provide updates if we run into issues again. We found that page analytics events, such as page views and page edits, did not save during the time of this incident. Impacted users may see their page related analytics as undercounted for February 13, 2023. Our team is looking into how we can prevent this from happening in the future. We appreciate your patience while we work on making these improvements. Feb 13, 08:17 PST Investigating - Notion users may experience general performance slowness. Engineering is currently investigating and implementing mitigations.

entry.title: Issues Affecting Guest Name Parameters in Webhooks
entry.summary: Feb 9, 17:43 PST Resolved - A fix has been implemented as of Feb 9, 10:00 UTC and webhooks should be returning names in full as expected. We have been monitoring the situation since, and have marked the incident as resolved as of Feb 9, 20:10 UTC. Do let us know via the Partner Portal if still experiencing issues. We deeply regret this incident and sincerely apologize for any inconvenience caused to you. Thank you for your patience and understanding. Feb 9, 02:54 PST Update - We are continuing to investigate the issue. In the event reservation webhook notifications are still returning only initials for the guest name parameters, please attempt a GET reservations request. We apologize for the inconvenience caused and are working towards a resolution. Feb 8, 21:42 PST Investigating - We are currently investigating issues with webhooks where guest name parameters are not returning the names in full. We will provide further updates as we learn more. Apologies for the inconvenience caused.
